item.title: Cement Sector Regulatory Relief Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 192.
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 201.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 165 (Roll no. 746). (text: CR H6523)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 257 - 165 (Roll no. 746).(text: CR H6523)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6532-6533)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 419, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Nugent demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H6528)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 419.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6523-6528)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 78.

No amendment to the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute shall be in order except those received for printing in the portion of the Congressional Record designated for that purpose in clause 8 of rule XVIII in a daily issue dated October 4, 2011, or earlier and except pro forma amendments for the purpose of debate. No amendment to the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute shall be in order except those received for printing in the portion of the Congressional Record designated for that purpose in clause 8 of rule XVIII in a daily issue dated October 4, 2011, or earlier and except pro forma amendments for the purpose of debate.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-231, by Mr. Nugent.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-231, by Mr. Nugent.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2681) to provide additional time for the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue achievable standards for cement manufacturing facilities, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2250) to provide additional time for the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue achievable standards for industrial, commercial, and institutional boilers, process heaters, and incinerators.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2681) to provide additional time for the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue achievable standards for cement manufacturing facilities, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2250) to provide additional time for the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to issue achievable standards for industrial, commercial, and institutional boilers, process heaters, and incinerators, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
